Class Inventory

java.lang.Object
Inventory
public class Inventory extends Object
Creates an instance of an Object of type Inventory. The inventory holds the player's items.
Version:
1.0
Author:
Angelo Gasmin

      Returns the contents of the bag.
      Returns:

    • getSize

      public int getSize()
      Returns the size of the bag. The size correlates to number of unique items.
      Returns:
      an integer of the size of the bag.

    • getItem

      public Item getItem(int i)
      Returns the item in the i-th index in the player's inventory.
      Parameters:
      i - Counter to get i-th item in bag
      Returns:
      Object of parent class Item

    • buyItem

      public void buyItem(int amount, Object item, Player player)
      Buy's an item from the shop and adds it to the player's inventory and deducts money accordingly.
      Parameters:
      amount - Number of items bought
      item - The type of item bought
      player - The player

    • sellItem

      public void sellItem(int amount, int index, Player player, Inventory bag)
      Removes an item from the trainers inventory. Gives money to the trainer based on the selling price of the item.
      Parameters:
      amount - Amount of items to be sold
      index - Index of the item in the player's inventory
      player - The player
      bag - Inventory of the player

    • addtoBag

      public void addtoBag(Object item, int freq)
      Adds x amount of items into the player's inventory.
      Parameters:
      item - Item to be added to the player's inventory
      freq - Amount of the item to be added

    • removeBag

      public void removeBag(int index, int freq)
      Removes x amount of items from player's inventory.
      Parameters:
      index - Index of the item to be removed from the player's inventory
      freq - Amount of the item to be removed

      public String toString()
      Returns a string representation of the player's inventory
